adjective.description: Like a nucleus in form or appearance. Later (Microbiology): relating to or of the nature of a nucleoid.

noun.description: Biology. A structure comprising the genetic material of a prokaryotic cell, virus, or cellular organelle.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in John Ogilvie (1797–1867), lexicographer. From nucleus + -oid. In sense B. 1 after German Nucleoïd.
